Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • Menu
  • public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object
    A menu consists of a header and options. This class handles printing the choices to the screen as well as retrieving the answer. If an incorrect value is entered this class handles asking again for a valid answer.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String header
      Header or title to print for the menu.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> options
      Contains all the options for the game.
      private java.util.Scanner scanner
      Scanner used to get input from the console

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a menu given a header

    • Field Detail

      • scanner

        private java.util.Scanner scanner
        Scanner used to get input from the console

      • header

        private java.lang.String header
        Header or title to print for the menu. Also can be see as the name for the menu

      • options

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> options
        Contains all the options for the game. The key is the name of the option and the value is the object that is attached to the option

    • Constructor Detail

      • Menu

        public Menu​(java.lang.String header)
        Creates a menu given a header
        Parameters:
        header - header for the menu

    • Method Detail

      • addMenuOption

        public void addMenuOption​(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.Object object)
        Adds an option to the menu
        Parameters:
        name - name of the option
        object - object that is attached to the option

      • getChoice

        public int getChoice()
        Prints the menu to the user and gets the index for the chosen option. Keeps asking until a valid option is chosen.
        Returns:
        int input given

      • getNumberOptions

        public int getNumberOptions()
        Gets the total number of options for the menu
        Returns:
        number of options for the menu

      • getUserInputChoice

        private int getUserInputChoice()
        Gets an integer from the console. If the input is invalid, a value of -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        int given from console

      • printMenu

        private void printMenu()
        Prints the menu to the console and asks for input. That is it prints the header. all of the options, and the message asking to enter a choice.

      • printlnMessage

        private void printlnMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Prints a message to the console followed by a new line.
        Parameters:
        message - message to print to the console

      • printMessage

        private void printMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Prints a message to the console
        Parameters:
        message - message to print to the console
